intro: Phyllostegia renovans, commonly known as the silverleaf honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale yellow to greenish in color. Its leaves are often covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Phyllostegia renovans is often found in moist, wooded areas and can thrive in partial shade.
